title: Probability of Default
equation_latex: P \times D = P \t \times im \times es (d \times ef \times au \times lt \times du \times ri \times ng \times pe \times ri \times od \times T)
notes: This equation defines the probability of default. PD represents the probability that a borrower will default within a specified time period T. PD is a fundamental credit risk metric used in pricing credit derivatives and calculating credit risk capital requirements.

title: Cumulative Default Probability
equation_latex: C \times DP \t \times im \times es (T) = 1 - e \times xp \t \times im \times es (-l \times am \times bd \times a * T)
notes: This equation calculates the cumulative probability of default assuming constant hazard rate. CDP(T) represents the cumulative default probability by time T

title: Hazard Rate
equation_latex: l \times am \times bd \times a = -l \times n \t \times im \times es (1 - P \times D) / T
notes: This equation calculates the hazard rate from the probability of default. lambda represents the hazard rate

title: Survival Probability
equation_latex: Q \t \times im \times es (T) = e \times xp \t \times im \times es (-i \times nt \times eg \times ra \times l_{0}^{T} l \times am \times bd \times a \t \times im \times es (t) d \times t)
notes: This equation calculates the survival probability (probability of no default). Q(T) represents the probability of surviving to time T without default

title: Loss Given Default
equation_latex: L \times GD = 1 - R \times ec \times ov \times er \times y R \times at \times e
notes: This equation calculates the loss given default. LGD represents the percentage loss incurred if default occurs

title: Exposure at Default
equation_latex: E \times AD = N \times ot \times io \times na \times l * C \times ur \times re \times nt \times Ex \times po \times su \times re
notes: This equation calculates the exposure at default. EAD represents the amount owed to the lender at the time of default

title: Expected Loss
equation_latex: E \times L = P \times D * L \times GD * E \times AD
notes: This equation calculates the expected loss from credit exposure. EL represents the expected loss

title: Unexpected Loss
equation_latex: U \times L = L \times GD * E \times AD * s \times qr \times t \t \times im \times es (P \times D * (1 - P \times D))
notes: This equation calculates the unexpected loss (standard deviation of loss). UL represents the unexpected loss

title: Credit VaR
equation_latex: C \times re \times di \times t __A \times BB \times R0__ = E \times L + z_{a \times lp \times ha} * U \times L
notes: This equation calculates the credit Value at Risk. Credit VaR represents the loss at a given confidence level

title: Merton Model
equation_latex: E \times qu \times it \times y = C \times al \times l \t \times im \times es (A \times ss \times et \times s
notes: sigma_A

title: Merton Default Probability
equation_latex: P \times D = N \t \times im \times es ((-l \times n \t \times im \times es (V/D) - (m \times u - 0.5 * s \times ig \times ma_{A}^{2}) * T) / (s \times ig \times ma_{A} * s \times qr \times t \t \times im \times es (T)))
notes: This equation calculates the default probability under the Merton model. PD represents the default probability

title: Distance to Default
equation_latex: D \times D = (l \times n \t \times im \times es (V/D) + (m \times u - 0.5 * s \times ig \times ma_{A}^{2}) * T) / (s \times ig \times ma_{A} * s \times qr \times t \t \times im \times es (T))
notes: This equation calculates the distance to default under the Merton model. DD represents the number of standard deviations the firm value is from the default threshold. Higher DD indicates lower default probability.

title: Credit Spread
equation_latex: s = -l \times n \t \times im \times es (Q \t \times im \times es (T)) / T
notes: This equation calculates the credit spread from survival probability. s represents the credit spread

title: Intensity-Based Spread
equation_latex: s = l \times am \times bd \times a + L \times GD * l \times am \times bd \times a
notes: This equation approximates the credit spread using hazard rate and loss given default. s represents the credit spread

title: CDS Spread
equation_latex: s_{c \times ds} = (1 - R) * l \times am \times bd \times a
notes: This equation approximates the CDS spread under constant hazard rate. s_cds represents the CDS spread

title: CDS Pricing (Protection Buyer)
equation_latex: P \times V_{p \times re \times mi \times um} = s \times um_{i=1}^{n} s * d \times el \times ta_{i} * Q \t \times im \times es (t_{i}) * D \times F_{i}
notes: This equation calculates the present value of premium payments for a CDS. PV_premium represents the PV of premiums

title: CDS Pricing (Protection Seller)
equation_latex: P \times V_{d \times ef \times au \times lt} = s \times um_{i=1}^{n} (1 - R) * E \times AD * (Q \t \times im \times es (t_{i-1}) - Q \t \times im \times es (t_{i})) * D \times F_{i}
notes: This equation calculates the present value of default leg payments. PV_default represents the PV of default payments

title: CDS Par Spread
equation_latex: s_{p \times ar} = P \times V_{d \times ef \times au \times lt} / P \times V_{a \times nn \times ui \times ty}
notes: This equation calculates the par CDS spread that makes the CDS value zero. s_par represents the par spread

title: CDS Value
equation_latex: V_{c \times ds} = P \times V_{d \times ef \times au \times lt} - s * P \times V_{a \times nn \times ui \times ty}
notes: This equation calculates the value of an existing CDS. V_cds represents the CDS value

title: CDS Delta
equation_latex: D \times el \times ta_{c \times ds} = (1 - R) * Q \t \times im \times es (T) / P \times V_{a \times nn \times ui \times ty}
notes: This equation calculates the delta of a CDS. Delta_cds represents the sensitivity to the survival probability

title: CDS DV01
equation_latex: D \times V01_{c \times ds} = D \times el \times ta_{c \times ds} * D \times V01_{b \times on \times d}
notes: This equation calculates the DV01 of a CDS. DV01_cds represents the sensitivity to interest rate changes

title: Upfront Payment
equation_latex: U \times P = (s_{m \times ar \times ke \times t} - s_{c \times ou \times po \times n}) * D \times V01_{c \times ds}
notes: This equation calculates the upfront payment for a CDS. UP represents the upfront payment

title: CDS Index Spread
equation_latex: s_{i \times nd \times ex} = s \times um_{i=1}^{n} w_{i} * s_{i}
notes: This equation calculates the spread of a CDS index. s_index represents the index spread

title: Tranche Attachment Point
equation_latex: A \times P = s \times um_{i=1}^{k} w_{i}
notes: This equation calculates the attachment point of a CDO tranche. AP represents the attachment point (percentage of portfolio losses that must occur before the tranche suffers losses)

title: Tranche Detachment Point
equation_latex: D \times P = s \times um_{i=1}^{k} w_{i} + w_{t \times ra \times nc \times he}
notes: This equation calculates the detachment point of a CDO tranche. DP represents the detachment point (percentage of portfolio losses that wipe out the tranche)

title: Expected Tranche Loss
equation_latex: E \times TL = i \times nt \times eg \times ra \times l_{A \times P}^{D \times P} (x - A \times P) * f_{L}(x) d \times x
notes: This equation calculates the expected loss of a CDO tranche. ETL represents the expected tranche loss

title: Tranche Spread
equation_latex: s_{t \times ra \times nc \times he} = E \times TL / P \times V_{a \times nn \times ui \times ty}
notes: This equation calculates the spread of a CDO tranche. s_tranche represents the tranche spread

title: Gaussian Copula
equation_latex: C \times or \times r \t \times im \times es (L_{i}
notes: Credit Derivatives - Structured Credit

title: Base Correlation
equation_latex: r \times ho_{b \times as \times e} = f \t \times im \times es (A \times P
notes: market_spreads)

title: Compound Poisson Default Process
equation_latex: d \times N_{t} = l \times am \times bd \times a d \times t + d \times M_{t}
notes: This equation models defaults as a compound Poisson process. dN_t represents the change in the number of defaults

title: Credit Migration Matrix
equation_latex: P_{i \times j} = P \t \times im \times es (t \times ra \times ns \times it \times io \times n f \times ro \times m r \times at \times in \times g i \times to \times ra \times ti \times ng \times j)
notes: This equation defines the credit migration probability. P_ij represents the probability that an obligor migrates from rating i to rating j over a given time period. Migration matrices are used in multi-period credit risk models.

title: Markov Chain Credit Model
equation_latex: P \t \times im \times es (t) = e \times xp \t \times im \times es (M * t)
notes: This equation calculates the transition probability matrix for a Markov chain credit model. P(t) represents the transition matrix over time t

title: Credit Rating Migration
equation_latex: P \times D_{k}(t) = s \times um_{i=1}^{n} P_{i}(0) * P_{i \times k}(t)
notes: This equation calculates the probability of being in rating k at time t. PD_k(t) represents the probability

title: Credit Portfolio Loss
equation_latex: L = s \times um_{i=1}^{n} L \times GD_{i} * E \times AD_{i} * L_{i}
notes: This equation calculates the total loss from a credit portfolio. L represents the portfolio loss

title: Vasicek One-Factor Model
equation_latex: L_{i} = N \t \times im \times es ((Y_{i} - s \times qr \times t \t \times im \times es (r \times ho) * Z) / s \times qr \times t \t \times im \times es (1 - r \times ho))
notes: This is the Vasicek one-factor model for portfolio credit risk. L_i represents the default indicator for obligor i

title: Asymptotic Single-Risk Factor
equation_latex: P \times D_{i} = N \t \times im \times es ((N^{-1}(P \times D_{i}) - s \times qr \times t \t \times im \times es (r \times ho) * Z) / s \times qr \times t \t \times im \times es (1 - r \times ho))
notes: This equation gives the conditional default probability under the ASRF framework. PD_i represents the conditional PD for obligor i

title: Credit VaR under ASRF
equation_latex: C \times re \times di \times t __A \times BB \times R0__ = L \times GD * E \times AD * (N \t \times im \times es ((N^{-1}(P \times D) + s \times qr \times t \t \times im \times es (r \times ho) * N^{-1}(0.999)) / s \times qr \times t \t \times im \times es (1 - r \times ho)) - P \times D)
notes: This equation calculates the 99.9% credit VaR under the ASRF model. Credit VaR represents the unexpected loss at the 99.9% confidence level

title: Default Correlation
equation_latex: r \times ho_{i \times j} = C \times or \times r \t \times im \times es (L_{i}
notes: Credit Derivatives - Credit Risk Basics

title: Asset Correlation
equation_latex: r \times ho_{a \times ss \times et} = C \times or \times r \t \times im \times es (V_{i}
notes: Credit Derivatives - Credit Risk Basics

title: Recovery Rate Distribution
equation_latex: R \times R = f \t \times im \times es (e \times co \times no \times mi \times c c \times on \times di \times ti \times on \times s
notes: collateral)

title: Credit Spread Curve
equation_latex: s \t \times im \times es (t) = -l \times n \t \times im \times es (Q \t \times im \times es (t)) / t
notes: This equation defines the credit spread curve. s(t) represents the credit spread for maturity t

title: Risky Bond Price
equation_latex: P_{r \times is \times ky} = s \times um_{i=1}^{n} C * Q \t \times im \times es (t_{i}) * D \times F_{i} + F * Q \t \times im \times es (T) * D \times F_{T}
notes: This equation prices a risky corporate bond. P_risky represents the bond price

title: Credit Spread Option Payoff
equation_latex: P \times ay \times of \times f = m \times ax \t \times im \times es (s_{T} - K
notes: Credit Derivatives - Credit Derivatives

title: Total Return Swap Payoff
equation_latex: P \times ay \times of \times f = (B \times on \times d R \times et \times ur \times n + C \times ou \times po \times n - L \times IB \times OR - S \times pr \times ea \times d) * N
notes: This equation gives the periodic payoff of a total return swap. Payoff represents the payment

title: Credit Linked Note Payoff
equation_latex: P \times ay \times of \times f = F - L \times GD * E \times AD * L_{d \times ef \times au \times lt}
notes: This equation gives the payoff of a credit linked note at maturity. Payoff represents the payment

title: Synthetic CDO Construction
equation_latex: V_{c \times do} = s \times um_{i=1}^{n} w_{i} * V_{c \times ds}
notes: Credit Derivatives - Structured Credit

title: First-to-Default Basket Payoff
equation_latex: P \times ay \times of \times f = (1 - R) * E \times AD * L_{1}
notes: This equation gives the payoff of a first-to-default basket. Payoff represents the payment

title: Nth-to-Default Basket Payoff
equation_latex: P \times ay \times of \times f = (1 - R) * E \times AD * (s \times um_{i=1}^{n} L_{i} - s \times um_{i=1}^{n-1} L_{i})
notes: This equation gives the payoff of an Nth-to-default basket. Payoff represents the payment

title: Credit Triangle
equation_latex: s = P \times D * L \times GD
notes: This equation shows the relationship between credit spread

title: Hazard Rate from Spread
equation_latex: l \times am \times bd \times a = s / (1 - R)
notes: This equation calculates the hazard rate from the CDS spread. lambda represents the hazard rate

title: CDS Curve Bootstrap
equation_latex: l \times am \times bd \times a_{i} = (s_{i} * (1 - R) - s \times um_{j=1}^{i-1} l \times am \times bd \times a_{j} * d \times el \times ta_{j} * Q \t \times im \times es (t_{j})) / (d \times el \times ta_{i} * Q \t \times im \times es (t_{i}))
notes: This equation bootstraps the hazard rate curve from CDS spreads. lambda_i is the hazard rate for period i
